hook.text: After the Norman Conquest, English almost died. But the peasants refused to let it go.

buildup.text: While nobles spoke French, millions of ordinary people kept using English every day.

discovery.text: The Black Death in 1348 killed so many nobles that English workers gained power.

twist.text: By 1362, English was back in Parliament. A royal statute made it the legal language.

climax.text: A language that spent three centuries underground emerged stronger and richer than before.

punchline.text: The survivors spoke English, and English survived because of them.

quiz.question: What event helped English reclaim power from French?
